text: Git is not ready. When all settings are correct you can configure commit-sync, etc.

label: Split timers for `commit` | `push`
tooltip: Enable to use one interval for `commit` and another for `push`.

label: ${action} interval
tooltip: ${action} every ${interval} minutes. Set to 0 to disable.

label: from last file edit
tooltip: If turned on, do auto ${action} every ${interval} minutes after last file change. This also prevents auto ${action} while editing a file.

label: from last commit
tooltip: If turned on, sets last auto ${action} timestamp to the latest commit timestamp. This reduces the frequency of auto ${action} when doing manual commits.

label: `push` interval
tooltip: `push` commits every 'n' minutes. Set to 0 to disable.

label: `pull` interval
tooltip: `pull` commits every 'n' minutes. Set to 0 to disable.

label: Custom commit message
tooltip: If enabled, you will get a pop up to specify your message.

label: Default commit message
tooltip: Available placeholders:
{{date}}
{{hostname}}
{{numFiles}} - number of changed files
{{files}} - list of changed files

label: On manual commit
tooltip: Available placeholders:
{{date}}
{{hostname}}
{{numFiles}} - number of changed files
{{files}} - list of changed files

label: {{date}} format
tooltip: Specify custom date format (see also Moment.js.

label: List affected filenames
tooltip: List affected filenames in the commit body

label: Only updates the HEAD without touching the working directory
Trigger on startup
tooltip: Automatically pull commits when Obsidian starts

label: Commit-and-sync
tooltip: Commit-and-sync with default settings means staging everything -> committing -> pulling -> pushing. Ideally this is a single action that you do regularly to keep your local and remote repository in sync.

label: Push
tooltip: Most of the time you want to push after committing. Turning this off turns a commit-and-sync action into commit and pull only. It will still be called commit-and-sync.

label: Pull
tooltip: On commit-and-sync, pull commits as well. Turning this off turns a commit-and-sync action into commit and push only.

label: Custom date format
tooltip: See more on our website.

label: Timezone
tooltip: The time-zone in which the authoring date should be shown. Either your local time-zone (default), the author's time-zone during commit creation or UTCÂ±00:00.

label: Oldest age in coloring
tooltip: The oldest age in the line author coloring. Everything older will have the same color.
Smallest valid age is '1d'. Currently: ${age}

label: Ignore whitespace and newlines in changes
tooltip: Whitespace and newlines are interpreted as part of the document and in changes by default (hence not ignored).
This makes the last line being shown as 'changed' when a new subsequent line is added, even if the previously last line's text is the same.
If you don't care about purely-whitespace changes (e.g. list nesting / quote indentation changes),
then activating this will provide more meaningful change detection.

label: History view
tooltip: Decide what to show in the history view of the commit.

label: Show Date
tooltip: Show the date of the commit in the history view. The {{date}} placeholder format is used to display the date.

label: Show Author
tooltip: Set the style for the diff view. Note that the actual diff in `Split` mode is not generated by Git, but the editor itself instead so it may differ from the diff generated by Git. One advantage of this is that you can edit the text in that view.

label: Disable informative notifications
tooltip: Disable informative notifications for git operations to minimize distraction (refer to status bar for updates).

label: Disable error notifications
tooltip: Disable errror notifications of any kind to minimize distraction (refer to status bar for updates).

label: Hide Notifications for no changes
tooltip: Don't show notifications when there are no changes to commit or push.

label: Show status bar
tooltip: !Obsidian must be restarted for the changes to take affect.

label: File menu integration
tooltip: Add `Stage`, `Unstage` and `Add` to `.gitignore` actions to the file menu.

label: Show branch status bar
tooltip: Obsidian must be restarted for the changes to take affect.

label: Show the count of modified files
tooltip: Show the count of modified files in the status bar.

label: Name
tooltip: Author name for commit

label: Email
tooltip: Type in your password. You won't be able to see it again.

label: Username
tooltip: Username on your git server. E.g. your username on GitHub

label: Password / Personal access token
tooltip: Type in your password. You won't be able to see it again.

label: Advanced
tooltip: These settings usually don't need to be changed, but may be requried for special setups.

label: Update submodules
tooltip: `Commit-and-sync` and `pull` take care of submodules. Missing features: Conflicted files, count of pulled/pushed/committed files. Tracking branch needs to be set for each submodule

label: Submodule recurse checkout/switch
tooltip: Whenever a checkout happens on the root repository, recurse the checkout on the submodules (if the branches exist).

label: Additional environment variables
tooltip: Use each line for a new environment variable in the format KEY=VALUE.

label: Additional PATH environment variable paths
tooltip: Use each line for one path.

label: Custom base path (Git repository path)
tooltip: Sets the relative path to the vault from which the Git binary should be executed.
Mostly used to set the path to the Git repository, which is only required if the Git repository is below the vault root directory. Use '\' instead of '/' on Windows.

label: Custom Git directory path (Instead of .git)
tooltip: !Requires restart of Obsidian to take effect. Use '\' instead of '/' on Windows.

label: Disable on this device
tooltip: Disables the plugin on this device. This setting is not synced.
